segment.source: MD Conversion - Windows Phone custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Windows Phone custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Windows Phone custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Windows Phone custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Use the Windows Phone custom configuration policy to deploy OMA-URI (Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier) settings that can be used to control features on Windows Phone 8.1 devices.
segment.target: Use the Windows Phone custom configuration policy to deploy OMA-URI (Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier) settings that can be used to control features on Windows Phone 8.1 devices.

segment.source: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.
segment.target: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.

segment.source: This capability is intended to allow you to deploy Windows Phone settings that are not configurable with an policy.
segment.target: This capability is intended to allow you to deploy Windows Phone settings that are not configurable with an policy.

segment.source: For information about the settings you can configure with these policies, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.
segment.target: For information about the settings you can configure with these policies, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.

segment.source: For help creating OMA-URI settings for Windows Phone devices, see Windows Phone 8.1 MDM protocol documentation.
segment.target: For help creating OMA-URI settings for Windows Phone devices, see Windows Phone 8.1 MDM protocol documentation.

segment.source: How to create a Windows Phone custom policy
segment.target: How to create a Windows Phone custom policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Under Windows, configure a Custom Configuration (Windows Phone 8.1 and later) policy.
segment.target: Under Windows, configure a Custom Configuration (Windows Phone 8.1 and later) policy.

segment.source: For help creating and deploying policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For help creating and deploying policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You can only create and deploy a custom policy.
segment.target: You can only create and deploy a custom policy.

segment.source: Recommended settings are not available.
segment.target: Recommended settings are not available.

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure the general policy settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure the general policy settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the policy to help you identify it in the console.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the policy to help you identify it in the console.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: In the OMA-URI Settings section, click Add to add a setting.
segment.target: In the OMA-URI Settings section, click Add to add a setting.

segment.source: You can also edit or delete an existing setting.
segment.target: You can also edit or delete an existing setting.

segment.source: In the Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting dialog box, specify the following information:
segment.target: In the Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting dialog box, specify the following information:

segment.source: Item
segment.target: Item

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.

segment.source: Setting description
segment.target: Setting description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.

segment.source: Data type
segment.target: Data type

segment.source: Select the date type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.
segment.target: Select the date type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.

segment.source: Choose from String, String (XML), Date and time, Integer, Floating point, or Boolean.
segment.target: Choose from String, String (XML), Date and time, Integer, Floating point, or Boolean.

segment.source: OMA-URI (Case Sensitive)
segment.target: OMA-URI (Case Sensitive)

segment.source: Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.
segment.target: Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI you specified previously.
segment.target: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI you specified previously.

segment.source: Click OK to save the setting and return to the Create Policy page.
segment.target: Click OK to save the setting and return to the Create Policy page.

segment.source: Continue to add as many settings as you require.
segment.target: Continue to add as many settings as you require.

segment.source: When you are done, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are done, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Deploy a Windows Phone Custom policy
segment.target: Deploy a Windows Phone Custom policy

segment.source: Deploy the policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
